Check out my article on testing interfaces with the Abstract Test
Pattern.

http://placebosoft.com/abstract-test.html

I would be happy to answer any questions you might have about this
technique.

On Thu, 2002-03-21 at 09:25, ircfantv wrote:
    Does anyone who's had some experience know whether or not JUnit can 
    perform unit tests on interfaces? 
    
    Specifically, we've defined a set of Interfaces to which vendors when 
    creating their product must implement and comply with. We'd like to 
    be able to test whether or not they have implemented the methods 
    we've defined in our interfaces correctly. These tests will include 
    verifying that the listeners, events, and graphics do what they're 
    supposed to do. Obviously, the graphics portion must be verified 
    visually, but what about the non-visual portions? 
    
    Can JUnit test this? 
    
    Thanks, 
    
    Adam
